answers.text:
That's a very good question Rhonda.  I am currently working on my Masters thesis that is looking into something very similar to your question.  "The effects of the Housing Bubble Crash on the Retirement Plans of the Baby Boomers: Case study Mission Viejo, CA.  I intend to survey residents on the impacts of the housing crash on the lost equity in their homes.  Also, how the lost wealth has affected their retirement plans, i.e. working longer and/or alternative migration decisions.  If cities are better educated of the possibilities, better planning and policies could be in place to positively impact a locality.

author: Rhoda Stauffer
text: Has anyone (towns of less than 10,000 population) done their own market assessment to determine the demand/need/market for housing unique to the needs of an aging population?  How do smaller towns meet the needs of their aging population when the overall market isn't sufficient for developers to build senior projects?
title: Assessing Market for Senior Housing
